unnormalised: So, I googled "best gastroenterologist near me" and ended up at Global Hospital, Parel. I was a bit apprehensive, as anyone would be, but the Dr., Dr. Iyer, was super chill. She asked a ton of questions and then recommended a bunch of tests - blood work, an ultrasound, and even a colonoscopy. I was like, "Colonoscopy? Seriously?".

She asked a ton of questions and then recommended a bunch of tests - blood work, an ultrasound, and even a colonoscopy. I was like, "Colonoscopy? Seriously?".

unnormalised: Turns out, all those yummy but questionable street foods I’ve been indulging in have taken their toll. I was diagnosed with IBS - Irritable Bowel Syndrome. Dr. Iyer explained that IBS affects the large intestine and causes symptoms like cramping, abdominal pain, bloating, gas, and diarrhoea or constipation, or sometimes even both! She said my symptoms were pretty mild, thank God. She also mentioned that around 15% of Indians suffer from IBS at some point in their lives.
normalised: Turns out, all those yummy but questionable street foods I've been indulging in have taken their toll. I was diagnosed with I-B-S - Irritable Bowel Syndrome. Doctor Iyer explained that I-B-S affects the large intestine and causes symptoms like cramping, abdominal pain, bloating, gas, and diarrhoea or constipation, or sometimes even both! She said my symptoms were pretty mild, thank God. She also mentioned that around fifteen percent of Indians suffer from I-B-S at some point in their lives.

unnormalised: She put me on a diet plan (say goodbye to my beloved Pani Puri!), prescribed some probiotics and antispasmodics, and told me to reduce stress (easier said than done in Mumbai!). She said specific medicine like Hyoscyamine 0.125mg, would help relieve the pain. Also, she recommended dietary changes like increasing the intake of fiber to 25g per day.

Also, she recommended dietary changes like increasing the intake of fiber to twenty five grams per day.

unnormalised: It's been a few weeks now, and honestly, I feel much better. The pain is almost gone, and I'm slowly learning to love bland food (kidding... mostly!). I'm also trying to incorporate yoga and meditation into my daily routine to manage stress.
